projects.title: MemoryKPR Hybrid Semantic Search and Media Governance
projects.subtitle: AI-Powered Image Retrieval with Built-in Content Safety

meta.context: University project in collaboration with MemoryKPR

overview.problem: Media platforms require intelligent search systems that understand natural language while maintaining strict content safety standards. Traditional keyword-based search fails to capture user intent, and manual content moderation doesn't scale.
overview.solution: Built a hybrid semantic search system combining statistical NLP and deep learning models, with automated NSFW filtering to create a safe, discoverable media platform.

content.heading: Hybrid Embedding Ensemble
content.description: Developed a weighted ensemble model combining spaCy (statistical NLP) and Hugging Face Transformers (contextual embeddings). The weighted sum balances the speed of traditional word vectors with the deep semantic understanding of attention-based models.
content.technical_note: Used cosine similarity to map user text inputs into the same high-dimensional space as image labels, enabling 'fuzzy' searches that understand intent rather than exact keywords.

content.solution: Fine-tuned similarity thresholds to reduce false positives, ensuring the system only surfaced highly relevant imagery while maintaining recall.
